intro: Sipanea setacea, commonly known as the hairy sipanea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems covered in fine, hairy structures. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a feathery appearance, and are often covered in fine hairs. Sipanea setacea is typically found in moist, temperate regions and is often associated with sandy or gravelly soils.
